title: Romina Ferro
text:
Romina Ferro (born 26 June 1980) is an <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="women%27s%20soccer">football</a> goalkeeper. She has played in her country as well as for <a href="Levante%20UD%20%28women%29">Levante UD</a> and <a href="Oviedo%20Moderno">Oviedo Moderno</a> in <a href="Spain">Spain</a>'s <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20%28women%29">Primera División</a>.
She has been a member of the <a href="Argentina%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Argentine national team</a>. She was the first-choice goalkeeper in the <a href="2003%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2003 World Cup</a>, playing all three games against <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan</a>, <a href="Canada%20women%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">Canada</a> and <a href="Germany%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Germany</a> and in the <a href="2006%20South%20American%20Women%27s%20Football%20Championship">2006 South American Championship</a>, which Argentina won. She started the <a href="2007%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2007 World Cup</a> as a reserve, but after a crushing defeat (0–11) against Germany she played the other two games against Japan and <a href="England%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">England</a>.
